data.name: 3DMark Port Royal upgrade
data.detailed_description:
This optional upgrade is only for people who bought 3DMark before January 8, 2019.


To use this content, you need the Windows 10 October 2018 Update and a graphics card that supports Microsoft DirectX Raytracing. The NVIDIA DLSS feature test additionally requires an NVIDIA graphics card that supports DLSS, such as a GeForce RTX series, Quadro RTX series or TITAN RTX. You must also have the latest NVIDIA drivers for your graphics card.

Port Royal benchmark

3DMark Port Royal is the world’s first real-time ray tracing benchmark for gamers. It shows you how well your PC handles ray tracing effects in real-time, a taste of what to expect from games in 2019. Use Port Royal to benchmark graphics cards that support Microsoft DirectX Raytracing. Compare Port Royal benchmark scores to see how overclocking affects ray tracing performance. Find your PC's performance limits with custom benchmark settings and detailed hardware monitoring charts.

Port Royal Stress Test

Check the reliability and stability of your system after buying or building a new PC, upgrading your graphics card or overclocking your GPU. Stress testing can also identify faulty hardware and a need for better cooling.

Compatibility

3DMark Port Royal was developed with input from AMD, Intel, NVIDIA, and other leading technology companies. We worked especially closely with Microsoft to create a first-class implementation of the DirectX Raytracing API. Port Royal will run on any graphics card that supports DirectX Raytracing. As with any new technology, there are limited options for early adopters, but more cards are expected to get DirectX Raytracing support in 2019.

NVIDIA DLSS feature test

Deep Learning Super Sampling (DLSS) is an NVIDIA RTX technology that uses the power of deep learning and AI to improve game performance while maintaining visual quality. This feature test helps you compare performance and image quality with and without DLSS.

data.short_description: This optional upgrade unlocks the Port Royal real-time ray tracing benchmark and the NVIDIA DLSS feature test for people who bought 3DMark before January 8, 2019.
data.supported_languages: English, German, Simplified Chinese, Russian, Spanish - Spain, Japanese, Korean

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS:Windows 10, 64-bit with October 2018 Update (version 1809)
  • Processor:1.8 GHz dual-core with SSSE3 support
  • Memory:4 GB RAM
  • Graphics:DirectX 12 with DirectX Raytracing support*
  • Video memory:6 GB
  • Storage:0.8 GB space

* The NVIDIA DLSS feature test additionally requires an NVIDIA graphics card that supports DLSS, such as a GeForce RTX series, Quadro RTX series or TITAN RTX. You must also have the latest NVIDIA drivers for your graphics card.

movies.name: 3DMark Port Royal — Real-time ray tracing benchmark — Full Demo 1440p
